intro: Shirakiopsis aubrevillei, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
